result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Jay Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary Jay Simpson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary Jay Simpson was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Defendant to sign up for Probation today December 5, 2014.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of the 4 year Deferred Judgment of Conviction, but must petition the Court.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Restition to be determined within 30 days - to be collected by  the Clerk of Court.
Joint and Several with Co-Defendant.
Defendant to pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
To be paid within 60 days to the Clerk of Court.

-Write an apology letter to all 3 Victims within 30 days and submit to Agent.
-Obtain High School Diploma or GED.
-Obtain full time employment or attend school full time or a combination of the two.
-No Contact with the 3 Victims except for apology letter.
-Completion of Restorative Justice Program to be determined by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
As directed by Agent.
Concurrent with:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Jay Simpson

records.addlTxt: From DE stating he has been trying to make pymt online but can't get thru. Ret'd call to DE & advised him his debt has been turned over to Coll (SDC) & was given their ph #. DE was advised that the Bookkeeper attempted to call him & left a v/m re: his short pymt & b/c pymt was still short, we turned the debt over. It appears that the ph # on file is no longer correct. DE also advised that we sent him a letter re: pymt as well. DE stated he will ck his mail. Address on file was confirmed. DE advised to contact SDC to set up a Pymt Plan & if his debt is deemed Uncollectible, the court will elect to take the debt back & issue a FTP WA. Includes 14CF217, 14CF252, 14CF253, 14CF254, 16CF346. jaf
To DE advising him his debt has been turned over to Coll (SDC) due to his pymt made on 1/6/21 being short. Includes 14CF217, 14CF252, 14CF253, 14CF254, 16CF346. jaf

Gave DEF a courtesy call and left a VM to let him know his 12-6-20 payment only paid him up through December, because he missed his November payment.  DEF did make a payment in November on 20TR2014, but that case is not on his payment plan.  Gave DEF until 1-1-2021 to make $100 payment to bring him current.  If payment of only $50 is made in December, balance due will be turned over to SDC. cah

Adding 16CF346 to current PPA plus add'l fees. DE to continue paying $50/mo comm 6-30-19.  DE will be mailed an updated copy of his last signed PPA.  Includes 14CF217, 14CF252, 14CF253, 14CF254, 16CF346. jaf

DE appeared after court for a Pymt Plan.  DE was advised that he is already on a Pymt Plan & is current, but that 2 of the cases on this Pplan were just ordered to be pd thru Probation.  DE was advised that upon speaking to the Clerk, the DE may keep his Pplan & make his pymts here rather than breaking them up.  DE was advised that he is current until 2-28-19 & that I will be mailing him an updated Pplan w/all unpd balances added to it & the add'l assessments he was just ordered in court w/a current bal.  DE stated he understood.  DE's address & phone # were verified.  Includes 14CF217, 14CF253, 14CF254.  jaf
From Atty Bosworth requesting to be removed from the case. hml
Final notice sent, due 5-17-18. cah

From DE on 11-27-15 asking if he had a pymt due today.  Ret'd call to DE today & advised him he has already been issued a WA for non pymt.  DE stated he was confused about pymt due dates, so he was advised to follow what's written on his agmt that he signed with pymts being due the 28th of ea mo.  DE missed his Oct pymt, which was pd on 11-28-15 & Nov pymt is now past due.  DE stated he cannot make another pymt until Fri, but would attempt to get someone to make pymt for him to put him current for Nov.  DE was advised he can turn himself into jail, pay the bal, or write the judge a letter.  Includes 14CF254, 14CF252, 14CF217, 14CF253. jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Carey, ADA: A McKinley, DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Zachary Jay Simpson appeared.  Includes 14CF217, 14CF252, 14CF253 and 14CF254.  Agreement outlined, def will plead to 4 misdemeanors and placed on probation with a DJOC on 2 felony counts.  Court reviews consequences of felony conviction.  Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights.  
14CF217 - Court reads charge and possible penalties,  Ct 1 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty.  Court stays adjudication pending full performance of the DJOC presented to the Court.  Ct 2 and 3 dismissed.  
14CF252 - Court reads charge and possible penalties for Ct 1 - def pleads guilty.  Ct 3 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudicates def guilty of both counts.  Court stays adjudication for Ct 1 pending full performance of the DJOC presented to the Court.  Ct 3 - adjudication entered.  Ct 2 - dismissed. 
14CF253 - Court reads charge and possible penalties for Ct 2 & 3 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis and adjudicates def guilty of both counts.  Ct 1 - dismissed.
14CF254 - Court reads charges and possible penalties for Ct 2 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty.  Ct 1 - dismissed.

Sentence: withheld, 2 years probation (concurrent). 
14CF252 - Ct 3
14CF253 - Ct 2 & 3
14CF254 - Ct 2
Conditions to include:
- write apology letter to 3 victims within 30 days, submit to agent
- obtain high school diploma or GED
- obtain full time employment or attend school full time or a combination of the two
- 200 hrs community service as directed by agent
- no contact with any of the 3 victims except for apology letter
- complete restorative justice program to be determined by agent
- pay restitution TBD within 30 days (joint in several with co-def)
- costs total $972.00 to be paid within 60 days to the Clerk of Court 

Def to sign up for probation today.  Def eligible for expungement upon successful completion of the 4 year DJOC.   

14CF217 - Ct 1 and 14CF252 - Ct 1:  DJOC reviewed with def.  Court approves agreement and signs order.  Bond amended for these two files and will continue for duration of the agreement.  Other bonds are discharged.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Aaron Anton Nelson, DF:  Zachary Jay Simpson appeared. Prelim on 14CF252, 14CF253 and 14CF254; also status on 14CF217. Filed by ADA McKinley. km

*INCLUDES 14CF252, 14CF253 AND 14CF254*

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Albert T. and his property; James W. and his property; Michael K. and his property; Andrew E.; Austin A.; D.R.M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Defendant to reside with parents on house arrest, and be in the presence of parent at all times; except while working. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  Aaron Anton Nelson, DF:  Zachary Jay Simpson appeared. Includes PTC in 14CF217 and INIT on 14CF252, 14CF253 and 14CF254.
